definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern

sentences.english: Thi provide the hip with an effective protection againt torpedoe attack.
sentences.chinese: 这对舰船抵御鱼雷攻击提供了有效保护。

sentences.english: Of course, exercise and vitamin supplements can't head off all potential risks.
sentences.chinese: 当然，锻炼和维生素补充剂不能抵御所有的潜在风险。

sentences.english: They sandbagged their homes to keep out floods.
sentences.chinese: 他们在房屋周围垫上沙袋以抵御水灾。

sentences.english: Protected by lamellar armour, giving these horse archers better protection against enemy attacks.
sentences.chinese: 库尔德弓骑兵身穿鳞甲，能有效抵御敌军攻击。

sentences.english: It cannot defend against vulnerabilities in third-party scripts or servers.
sentences.chinese: 它不能抵御第三方脚本或服务器中的安全漏洞。

sentences.english: We'll just keep dreaming of our active cloaking that counters earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 我们将继续坚持我们抵御地震的梦想。

sentences.english: Interior organic cotton, exterior weather-resistant nylon fabric.
sentences.chinese: 内部是有机棉，外部是抵御冰冷气象的尼龙原料。

sentences.english: Nothing could be defensed but for the lure.
sentences.chinese: 除了诱惑我什么都能抵御。

sentences.english: The doctor thinks right amount take vitaminic E to be able to resist effectively anile .
sentences.chinese: 医生认为适量服用维他命E能有效抵御衰老。

sentences.english: Right mindfulness is a shield that protects us from our enemies.
sentences.chinese: 正念如盾牌，可以抵御强敌，何卫自身。

sentences.english: All the people had been armed to defend their country against imperialist and colonialists.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人被武装抵御帝国主义和殖民主义的国家。

sentences.english: She has become so poor that she has little power of resisting famines.
sentences.chinese: 印度已经穷得对饥荒没有抵御能力了。

sentences.english: Driving the branches into firm snow gives a quick and easy lean-to to keep the wind off.
sentences.chinese: 将树枝深埋于雪中可以简单迅速的抵御寒风。

sentences.english: Firstly, to further improve ability to resist flood and drought disasters.
sentences.chinese: 第一，进一步提高抵御水旱灾害的能力。

sentences.english: He also said that Lorca old building is not easy to resist earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 他还说，洛尔卡的建筑老旧，也不容易抵御地震。

sentences.english: To prepare for an attack by raiders, Kardaine prays to the Father to inspire courage.
sentences.chinese: 为了抵御掠袭者攻击，卡典向天父祈祷让他鼓起勇气。

definition: to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to avoid suffering/to prevent (sth bad)/to protect against (damage)/immunity (from prosecution)/freedom (from pain, damage etc)/exempt from punishment
to make (military) incursions/to invade/to intrude into/to trespass/to gain unauthorized access (computing)
